intro: Dicrypta elatior, commonly known as the tall mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white or pale flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance to aid in attachment to host plants. Dicrypta elatior relies on its host for water and nutrients but can photosynthesize to some extent. Its ecological role includes providing food for birds and other animals that consume its berries.
